content: Is it possible to use Jupyterhub for teaching Lean 4? Can it be set up to show code and Infoview at the same time?

I don't know how relevant it is, but Coq can be used in Jupyter:
https://github.com/EugeneLoy/coq_jupyter
Martin Dvořák has marked this topic as resolved.

Just to clarify: the jupyter kernel shown there is for lean3. It could probably be easily adapted to lean4, but it not done yet.

I am also considering trying to write a jupyterlab extension to have a behaviour similar to the vscode experience: a file editor, and a parallel window showing the status of the proofs. But it might take a considerable effort, given that i have very little experience with jupyterlab extensions.

Would you find it useful?
I decided not to use Jupyterhub for my course.
